Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates generally to peptides and more specifically to antimicrobial and immunomodulatory host defense peptides.
The present invention relates generally to peptides and more specifically to antimicrobial and immunomodulatory host defense peptides.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: W4 (single amino acid substitution of Bac034, which is a scrambled Variant of Bac2A)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC>50 µg/ml), Escherichia coli (MIC=6 µg/ml), Salmonella (MIC>50 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=50 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=3 µg/ml).Yeast:Candida albicans (MIC=50 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Has antibacterial activiy against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.

Literature.Title: Sequence requirements and an optimization strategy for short antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Author: Hilpert K, Elliott MR, Volkmer-Engert R, Henklein P, Donini O, Zhou Q, Winkler DF, Hancock RE.
